pull.title: guix: consistently use -ffile-prefix-map
pull.body:
Aside from being the [newer, more comprehensive option](https://reproducible-builds.org/docs/build-path/), it's what we
claim to use in the patch docs, and everywhere else in guix.

verification.payload:
tree 7dea74965a3c5ed79547b1ca8aeb56df8066470c
parent 5291933fedceb9df16eb9e4627b1d7386b53ba07
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1662454248 +0100
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1662454315 +0100

guix: consistently use -ffile-prefix-map

Aside from being the newer, more comprehensive option, it's what we
claim to use in the patch docs, and everywhere else in guix.

events.message:
guix: consistently use -ffile-prefix-map

Aside from being the newer, more comprehensive option, it's what we
claim to use in the patch docs, and everywhere else in guix.

events.body:
> Aside from being the [newer, more comprehensive option](https://reproducible-builds.org/docs/build-path/),

No need to use "newer, more comprehensive option", when job is done with the current option. But it won't hurt :)

> it's what we claim to use in the patch docs

Then patch docs should be adjusted.

> and everywhere else in guix.

Agree with this point.

Considering all points above, approach ACK af2a7c89430856c326e971018c1e1e0813739339.
